div.l: But sche were well norisched ⁊and a maide
To sauyn his estate of yomanrye
And sche was proud ⁊and pert as is a pye
A ful fair sight was it vp on hem two
On halidaies bi forn hir wolde he go
With his tipet woıı̄unden a boute his heed
And sche cam after in a gite of reed
And Symkyn had hosen of the same
Ther durste no wight clepen hir but dame
Was noon so hardy that wente be the weie
That with hire durste ones rage or pleie
But if he wolde be slayn of Symkyn
With panade or with knyf or boidekyn
For ielous folk been ꝑperilous euyr mo
Algate thei wolde here wyues wenden so
And ek for sche was somdell smot̉erlich
Sche was as digne as water in a dich
As full of hoker ⁊and of bismare
Hir thought that a lady shulde hir spare
What for hir kynrede ⁊and hir nortelrie
That sche had lerned in the Nonnerie
A doughter had thei be twixe hem two
Of twenty yere with outen ony mo
Sauyng a childe that was of half yere age
In cradill it lay ⁊and was a propre page
This wenche thikke ⁊and well growen was
With Camois nose ⁊and yen graie as glas
With buttokes brode ⁊and brestis roıı̄unde ⁊and hye
But right faire was hir her I will nought lye
¶ The ꝑperson of the toun for sche was so faire
In purpos was to make hir his haire
Bothe of his catell ⁊and his messuage
And stᵃrange he made it of hir mariage
His purpos was to be stowe hir hye
In to som worthi blood of Auncetrie
For holy chirche good moot ben dispended
On holy chirche blood that is descended
Therfore he wolde his holy blood honour
Though that he holy chirche schulde deuour
¶ Grete soken hath this Miller out of doute
With whete ⁊and malte of all the londe a boute
And namely ther was a gret College
Men clepeth the Soler halle at Cantabregge
Ther was here whete ⁊and ek here malt groıı̄unde
And on a day it happed in a stoıı̄unde
Sik lay the manciple on a maladie
Men wenden wisly that he schulde dye
